message: I have an amazing product that I think you'll love. It's a unique opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. $12000 is a good price, but I'm hoping to get it for a bit less. I'd be willing to pay $10000 for it.  Let me know what you think.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. I can see you're interested in the product, but I have to make a living, you know. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $12500. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I'm still hoping to get a better price.  I'd be willing to pay $11000 for the product. Let's try to close this deal.

I can see you're serious about getting this deal done, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price. I'm counteroffering at $13000. This is as low as I can go, so I hope you can meet me here.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $13000 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to go up to $11500 for the product. If you're willing to meet me there, we can finalize this deal.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I've already given you a significant discount. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm not losing too much. I'm counteroffering at $13500. This is my final offer, so I hope you can meet me here.
